messages.pathNotFound: Path does not exist on filesystem
messages.pathNotFoundMessage: The path for this no longer exists on the filesystem. It may have been moved or deleted.
messages.pathReassignFailed: Failed to update path. Please try again.
messages.incompleteResultsDetails: Showing max results ({max}). Try narrowing your search to get more results under {max}.

buttons.generateNewOtp: Reset and generate new two-factor code
buttons.selectedCount: Number of items selected to perform an action

upload.abortUpload: Are you sure you want to abort?

errors.forbidden: You don't have permissions to access this.
errors.failedToConnectToServer: Failed to connect to the server, is it still running?

files.noPreview: Preview is not available for this file.

help.marqueeSelect: select multiple files or directories by dragging on empty space
help.esc: clear selection and/or close the prompt
help.description: You can view the basic naviagation options below. For additional information, please visit

share.notice: Note: when a share is a created, it becomes more exposed to the public and has different rules for access. If your share is not securely configured, it may be accessed by anyone.
share.disableAnonymousDescription: Only authenticated users can access the share. The user must have access to the source of the share.
share.disableThumbnailsDescription: Preview thumbnails will not be shown in the share.
share.enableAllowedUsernamesDescription: Only the specified users can access the share. The user must have access to the source of the share.
share.downloadsLimitDescription: The maximum number of times any file/folder from the share can be downloaded. Leave empty for unlimited.
share.maxBandwidthDescription: The maximum download bandwidth in kbps. Leave empty for unlimited.
share.shareThemeDescription: The theme to use for the share link
share.keepAfterExpiration: Do not delete share after it expires
share.keepAfterExpirationDescription: The share will not be deleted after it expires. This is useful if you want to extend a share's expiration or edit it further after it expires.
share.saveDisabled: Cannot save changes to shared files.
share.shareDurationDescription: Duration before the share expires. Leave blank for a permanent share.
share.passwordDescription: Optional password required to access this share, including authenticated users.
share.allowedUsernamesListDescription: Comma-separated usernames who can access the share (when enabled).
share.shareThemeColorDescription: CSS color value applied to the share's theme (e.g., red, #0ea5e9, rgb(14,165,233)).
share.shareTitleDescription: Custom page title shown on the share page.
share.shareDescriptionHelp: Short description shown on the share page (may be used in meta tags).
share.shareLogoDescription: Logo image URL or path accessible by the client -- either abosolute or index path are accepted: eg 'https://domain.com/logo.png' or '/path/to/logo.png'
share.shareBannerDescription: Banner image URL or path accessible by the client -- either abosolute or index path are accepted: eg 'https://domain.com/banner.png' or '/path/to/banner.png'
share.shareFaviconDescription: Favicon URL or path accessible by the client -- either abosolute or index path are accepted: eg 'https://domain.com/favicon.png' or '/path/to/favicon.png'
share.hideNavButtonsDescription: Hide the navigation buttons on the navbar in the share to create a minimalistic look.
share.viewModeDescription: Default layout for the shared page.
share.descriptionDefault: A share has been sent to you to view or download.
share.descriptionUploadDefault: A share has been sent to you to upload files.
share.disableShareCardDescription: Disable the share card on the shared page in the sidebar or at the top of the page on mobile.
share.disableSidebarDescription: Disable the sidebar on the shared page.
share.enforceDarkLightModeDescription: Force a specific theme mode (dark or light) for this share, overriding user preferences.
share.defaultViewModeDescription: Set the default view mode for anonymous users viewing this share. Logged-in users can still change their view preference.
share.enableOnlyOfficeDescription: Allow viewing office files using OnlyOffice in this share.
share.shareTypeDescription: The type of share to create. Normal shares allow viewing and downloading files. Upload shares allow uploading files to the share.
share.perUserDownloadLimit: Apply the downloads limit to each user
share.perUserDownloadLimitDescription: When enabled, the downloads limit will be applied to each user. Anonymous users will not be able to download any files from this share.
share.extractEmbeddedSubtitlesDescription: Extract embedded subtitles from media files on load -- this can be slow for large files.
share.disableLoginOptionDescription: Hide the login button in the sidebar for anonymous users. When enabled, anonymous users won't see the option to log in.
share.disableDownloadDescription: Anyone won't be able to download files or view a file's content.
share.allowModifyDescription: Anyone can edit files in this share.
share.allowDeleteDescription: Anyone can delete files and folders from this share.
share.allowCreate: Allow creating and uploading files and folders
share.allowCreateDescription: Anyone can create and upload new files and folders in this share.
share.allowReplacementsDescription: Anyone can replace existing files when uploading files with the same name.
share.shareInfoDescription: This link displays the share's information, including title, description, banner, and QR code in a popup.
share.downloadDescription: This link allows downloading the entire share content as a compressed file.

prompts.copyMessage: Choose the place to copy your files:
prompts.deleteMessageMultiple: Are you sure you want to delete {count} file(s)?
prompts.deleteMessageSingle: Are you sure you want to delete this file/folder?
prompts.deleteMessageShare: Are you sure you want to delete this share: {path} ?
prompts.deleteUserMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this user?
prompts.downloadMessage: Choose the format you want to download.
prompts.archiveMessage: Create an archive on the server from the selected items.
prompts.archiveDestination: Choose destination folder (then enter archive name below):
prompts.archiveDeleteAfter: Delete source files after successful creation
prompts.unarchiveMessage: Choose where to extract the archive.
prompts.moveMessage: Choose new house for your file(s)/folder(s):
prompts.newArchetype: Create a new post based on an archetype. Your file will be created on content folder.
prompts.newDirMessage: Write the name of the new directory.
prompts.newFileMessage: Write the name of the new file.
prompts.replaceMessage: One of the files you're trying to upload is conflicting because of its name. Do you wish to continue to upload or replace the existing one?
prompts.saveBeforeExitMessage: You have unsaved changes in the editor. What would you like to do?
prompts.scheduleMessage: Pick a date and time to schedule the publication of this post.
prompts.uploadSettingsChunked: Max concurrent uploads: {maxConcurrentUpload}, chunk size: {uploadChunkSizeMb} MB
prompts.uploadSettingsNoChunk: Max concurrent uploads: {maxConcurrentUpload}, chunked upload disabled
prompts.optionalPasswordHelp: If set, users must enter this password to view the shared content.
prompts.copyItemQuestion: Copy this item to the new location?
prompts.moveItemQuestion: Move this item to the new location?
prompts.closeWithActiveUploadsMessage: Warning: You have active uploads and closing the upload prompt could result in unfinished uploads. What would you like to do?
prompts.firstLoadBody: A new database was created on startup. If this is not what you expected, please double check your configuration file for `server.database` path and ensure it exists. On docker, database path could be `./data/database.db` or `./database.db`.
prompts.halloweenBody: The Halloween theme has been applied. You can disable it if you don't like it, or permanently disable it in profile settings by selecting any other theme.

search.typeToSearch: Start typing {minSearchLength} or more characters to begin searching.
search.noResults: No results found in indexed search.
search.showPreviewImagesDescription: Display thumbnail previews for search results when available, and show larger icons for all results.
search.helpText1: Search occurs on each character you type (3 character minimum for search terms).
search.helpText2: The index: Search utilizes the index which automatically gets updated on the configured interval (default: 5 minutes). Searching when the program has just started may result in incomplete results.

profileSettings.previewFolder: Show thumbnails for folders if available
profileSettings.previewFolderDescription: Show thumbnail previews for folders with first child item as cover -- or multiple items if motion preview is enabled.
profileSettings.debugOfficeEditorDescription: Show a debug popup with additional information in the OnlyOffice editor.
profileSettings.defaultMediaPlayer: Use your browser's native media player
profileSettings.defaultMediaPlayerDescription: Use your browser's native media player for video and audio files rather than FileBrowser's included 'vue-plyr' media player.
profileSettings.showSelectMultiple: Show select multiple in context menu on desktop
profileSettings.showSelectMultipleDescription: By default, desktop context menu does not have "select multiple" option like mobile. This option always shows it in the context menu.
profileSettings.showHiddenFilesDescription: Show hidden files in listing (e.g. .thumbnails, ProgramData), but they are still manually accessible if configured to be indexed.
profileSettings.showQuickDownload: Show download icon for quick access
profileSettings.showQuickDownloadDescription: Show download icon for quick access on each file item that can be clicked to download instantly.
profileSettings.previewImagesDescription: Show thumbnail previews for images, will show generic icon if disabled.
profileSettings.previewVideosDescription: Show thumbnail previews for videos, will show generic icon if disabled.
profileSettings.previewMotionVideosDescription: Motion preview is the animated popup preview that cycles through the frames of the video or multiple images for a folder
profileSettings.editOffice: View and edit office files with OnlyOffice
profileSettings.editOfficeDescription: When only office is enabled, the file viewer/editor will be disabled for all file extensions related to office files.
profileSettings.popupPreviewDescription: An overlay pop-up window will show over the UI when hovering over items with thumbnails
profileSettings.disableUpdateNotificationsDescription: Disable the update notification banner that shows up for admin users on the sidebar.
profileSettings.disableHideSidebar: Keep sidebar open when previewing or editing files
profileSettings.disableHideSidebarDescription: When enabled, the sidebar will not hide automatically when previewing or editing files.
profileSettings.autoplayMediaDescription: Autoplay media files when viewing. This will only work if the file is a media file.
profileSettings.disableQuickTogglesDescription: Disable the quick toggles that show up on the sidebar.
profileSettings.disableSearchOptionsDescription: Disable the search options that show up on the sidebar.
profileSettings.hideSidebarFileActions: Hide file actions button in sidebar
profileSettings.deleteWithoutConfirmingDescription: Delete files without confirmation prompt. This will only work if the file is a media file.
profileSettings.editorQuickSaveDescription: The text editor will always show the save icon, hiding any other actions
profileSettings.previewOfficeDescription: Show thumbnails for office file types in the listing view
profileSettings.disableThumbnailPreviews: Disable thumbnails for certain file extensions
profileSettings.disableThumbnailPreviewsDescription: A space-separated list of file extensions to disable thumbnail previews for (e.g., '.txt .html').
profileSettings.disableViewingFiles: Disable file viewer/editor for certain file extensions
profileSettings.disableViewingFilesDescription: A space-separated list of file extensions to disable the file viewer/editor for (e.g., '.txt .pdf').
profileSettings.disablePreviewExt: Disable office file previews for certain file extensions
profileSettings.disablePreviewExtDescription: A space-separated list of file extensions to disable office file previews for (e.g., '.docx .pptx').
profileSettings.disableOfficeEditorDescription: A space-separated list of file extensions to disable the OnlyOffice editor and viewer for - or '*' to disable for all. (e.g., '.txt .html .pdf').
profileSettings.disableOfficeEditor: Disable office viewer for certain file extensions
profileSettings.showThumbnailsDescription: When enabled, thumbnails are shown in the listing for items that support them. Turn off to hide all thumbnails.

settings.loginMethodDescription: allowed login method for the user.
settings.emptyGlobal: Currently there are no global config options, You can edit the configuration yaml to adjust system settings.
settings.scopes: Define allowed sources and the user scope within them
settings.allowEdit: Edit, rename and delete files or directories
settings.avoidChanges: also tick 'change password' to apply this password
settings.brandingHelp:
You can customize how your File Browser instance looks and feels by changing its name, replacing the logo, adding custom styles and even disable external links to GitHub.
For more information about custom branding, please check out the {0}.
settings.commandRunnerHelp: Here you can set commands that are executed in the named events. You must write one per line. The environment variables {0} and {1} will be available, being {0} relative to {1}. For more information about this feature and the available environment variables, please read the {2}.
settings.createUserDir: Auto create user home dir while adding new user
settings.tusUploadsHelp: File Browser supports chunked file uploads, allowing for the creation of efficient, reliable, resumable and chunked file uploads even on unreliable networks.
settings.tusUploadsChunkSize: Indicates to maximum size of a request (direct uploads will be used for smaller uploads). You may input a plain integer denoting a bytes input or a string like 10MB, 1GB etc.
settings.tusUploadsRetryCount: Number of retries to perform if a chunk fails to upload.
settings.userHomeBasePath: Base path for user home directories
settings.userScopeGenerationPlaceholder: The scope will be auto generated
settings.defaultUserDescription: These are the default settings for new users.
settings.executeOnShellDescription: By default, File Browser executes the commands by calling their binaries directly. If you want to run them on a shell instead (such as Bash or PowerShell), you can define it here with the required arguments and flags. If set, the command you execute will be appended as an argument. This apply to both user commands and event hooks.
settings.globalRules: This is a global set of allow and disallow rules. They apply to every user. You can define specific rules on each user's settings to override these ones.
settings.lockPassword: Prevent the user from changing the password

permissions.api: Create and manage long-live API Tokens

settings.permissionsHelp: User permissions control access to what type of actions the user can perform. Administrar access gives full control to update and change any user's settings as well as many system settings.
settings.ruleExample1: prevents the access to any dot file (such as .git, .gitignore) in every folder.
settings.ruleExample2: blocks the access to the file named Caddyfile on the root of the scope.
settings.rulesHelp: Here you can define a set of allow and disallow rules for this specific user. The blocked files won't show up in the listings and they wont be accessible to the user. We support regex and paths relative to the users scope.
settings.singleClick: Use single clicks to open files and directories
settings.userCommandsHelp: A space separated list with the available commands for this user. Example:

sidebar.dividerNamePlaceholder: Divider text (leave blank to show a line)
sidebar.customizeLinksDescription: Customize the links shown in your sidebar. Drag and drop to reorder.
sidebar.customizeShareLinksDescription: Customize the links shown in the sidebar for this share. Drag and drop to reorder.
sidebar.showIndexedUsageDescription: Display usage bar calculated from indexed files in the source.
sidebar.showDiskUsageDescription: Display usage bar from disk/partition size as reported by the OS. This size will likely be larger and includes files not indexed.
sidebar.usageTextDisplay: Which usage text should be displayed?
sidebar.onlyShowIndexedUsageDescription: When disabled, shows the total usage of the partition as reported by the OS instead of calculated indexed file totals for the source.
sidebar.sharePathPlaceholder: e.g., /subfolder or leave empty for root
sidebar.linkUrlPlaceholder: Enter URL or path (e.g., /files/path or https://example.com)
sidebar.linkIconPlaceholder: Optionally specify a material icon name
sidebar.pickIconDescription: Search and select an icon from the Material Icons library
sidebar.sourceNotAccessible: This source is no longer accessible to you
sidebar.noLinksYet: No links configured yet. Add your first link below.

api.title: API Tokens
api.keyNamePlaceholder: Enter a unique name for the API token
api.permissionNote: Choose at least one permission for the key. Your user must also have the permission.
api.description: API tokens are based on the user that creates them.
api.customizeTokenInfo: Customize the token permissions and attributes. This will create a longer token which may not work some WebDAV clients.
api.minimalInfo: Excludes token customizations, permissions will match the associated user and have no other attributes.

index.noSources: No sources available for this user. Either add a source for this user or configure a source with defaultEnabled: true

otp.name: Two-Factor Authentication
otp.verifyInstructions: Enter the code from your authenticator app
otp.generate: Scan the QR code with your authenticator app
otp.invalidCodeType: Verification code should be 6 english digits

access.deletedCascade: Access rules deleted from path and all subpaths!
access.defaultBehaviorDescription: This shows what happens when a user tries to access a path where no specific access rules exist. 'Allow' means users can access by default, 'Deny' means users are blocked by default unless explicitly allowed.
access.cascadeDeleteDescription: When enabled, deleting an access rule will also remove it from all subdirectories. This allows you to completely remove a user or group from the entire directory tree.

fileLoading.title: Uploads & Downloads
fileLoading.maxConcurrentUploadHelp: The maximum number of concurrent uploads. Higher values typically perform better, but this depends on many factors.
fileLoading.uploadChunkSizeMbHelp: Typically 5 to 50 MB, smaller is better for unstable or restricted connections. Setting to 0 will disable upload chunking.
fileLoading.downloadChunkSizeMbHelp: Chunk size for chunked downloads. Files larger than this size will be downloaded in chunks to prevent timeout issues (e.g., Cloudflare 524 errors). Setting to 0 disables chunked downloads.
fileLoading.clearAll: Clear completed should remove error, pause, and conflict
fileLoading.clearAllDescription: The clear completed button will clear all uploads in a finished state, including error, paused, and conflict states.

editor.uninitialized: Failed to initialize the editor. Please reload.
editor.saveFailed: Failed to save file. Please try again.
editor.saveAborted: Save aborted. The file name does not match the active file.
editor.saveAbortedMessage: Save operation aborted. The application's active file ({activeFile}) does not match the file you are trying to save ({tryingToSave}).
editor.syncFailed: failed to sync state with the route for "{filename}" after 5 attempts. Aborting editor setup to prevent data corruption.

player.changePlaybackModeHint: Change playback mode to see more files

fileSizeAnalyzer.title: File Size Analyzer
fileSizeAnalyzer.emptyState: Enter search criteria and click Analyze to visualize file sizes

tools.title: Tools
tools.description: Utilities and analysis tools for your files

sizeAnalyzer.name: File Size Analyzer
sizeAnalyzer.description: Visualize large files and directories with an interactive treemap

duplicateFinder.name: Duplicate File Finder
duplicateFinder.description: Find and manage duplicate files to reclaim storage space

materialIconPicker.name: Material Icon Picker
materialIconPicker.description: Browse and search Material Icons with live preview

fileWatcher.name: File Watcher
fileWatcher.description: Watch and tail files in real-time with latency monitoring
fileWatcher.emptyState: Choose a file and click play to begin monitoring file changes

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.description: View all notifications from your current session
notifications.clearConfirm: Are you sure you want to clear all notification history?

duplicateFinder.title: Duplicate File Finder
duplicateFinder.minSizeHint: Only analyze files larger than this size (in megabytes)
duplicateFinder.useChecksumsDescription: Also include file contents in the comparison. Without this, files are matched by size and filename similarity.
duplicateFinder.emptyState: Enter search criteria and click Find Duplicates to identify duplicate files

events.authenticationFailed: Authentication failed. Please refresh the page to log in again.
events.connectionLost: The connection to server was lost. Trying to reconnect...

onlyoffice.logsNotAvailable: Backend logs are not available -- user must be admin to view backend logs
onlyoffice.integrationFailed: OnlyOffice integration failed. Check the failed steps above.
onlyoffice.integrationSuccess: OnlyOffice integration initialized successfully. Monitor backend logs for any issues.
onlyoffice.editorSuccess: Editor Initialization - Success! All steps completed.
